model

Class Pokemon

  • java.lang.Object
    • model.Pokemon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Abra, Bulbasaur, Charizard, Cubone, Diglett, FindingPlayer, Human, Koffing, Lugia, Mew, MissingNo, Pidgeotto, Pikachu, Rapidash, Rayquaza, Scyther, Vulpix

    public abstract class Pokemon
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Cloneable, java.io.Serializable
    See Also:

        public void takeAttack(int damage)
        Damages the Pokemon, will never leave the Pokemon with a negative amount of hp. Subtracts the Pokemons defense, returns how much damage was taken.

      • setNoRand

        public static void setNoRand()
        USED ONLY FOR TESTING Prevents pokemon for using random values for anything instead they will always use half of the max amount for damage calculation assigning stats on level up etc

      • setRand

        public static void setRand()
        should be called in the teardown methods of any test

      • resetTemp

        public void resetTemp()
        Resets the temporary stats, should be called at the before battle

      • clone

        public Pokemon clone()
        Clone constructor: Should return a clone of the current Pokemon. Clone is necessary because the random Pokemon option utilizes the prototype design pattern and there is no way to clone a generic object in java. Note setAttacks MUST be called in this method as clone only creats a shallow copy of the pokemon.
        Overrides:
        clone in class java.lang.Object
